deposit(uint256).notice: withdraws asset from treasury, deposits asset into stability pool

ethToLUSDRatio().notice: The target percent of eth to swap to LUSD at uniswap.  divide by 1e6 to get actual value. Examples: 500000 => 500000 / 1e6 = 0.50 = 50% 330000 => 330000 / 1e6 = 0.33 = 33%

harvest(uint256).notice: claims LQTY & ETH Rewards.   minETHLUSDRate minimum rate of when swapping ETH->LUSD.  e.g. 3500 means we swap at a rate of 1 ETH for a minimum 3500 LUSD 1.  Harvest from LUSD StabilityPool to get ETH+LQTY rewards 2.  Stake LQTY rewards from #1.  This txn will also give out any outstanding ETH+LUSD rewards from prior staking 3.  If we have eth, convert to weth, then swap a percentage of it to LUSD.  If swap successul then send all remaining WETH to treasury 4.  Deposit LUSD from #2 and potentially #3 into StabilityPool

poolFee().notice: poolFee parameter for uniswap swaprouter, divide by 1e6 to get the actual value.  See https://docs.uniswap.org/protocol/guides/swaps/multihop-swaps#calling-the-function-1 Maximum allowed value is 10000 (1%) Examples: poolFee =  3000 =>  3000 / 1e6 = 0.003 = 0.3% poolFee = 10000 => 10000 / 1e6 =  0.01 = 1.0%

withdraw(address,uint256).notice: withdraws from stability pool, and deposits asset into treasury

userdoc.notice: Contract deploys reserves from treasury into the liquity stabilty pool, and those rewards  are then paid out to the staking contract.  See harvest() function for more details.
